options.text: Enterprise-Scale Analytics is a prescriptive reference architecture for data with reference implementation provided by Microsoft. Visit 'aka.ms/adopt/datamanagement' for more details about the solution pattern.
Select the subscription as well as the location to specify the scope of your Data Landing Zone deployment.

elements.name: subscriptionId
elements.label: Subscription
elements.toolTip: Select the Subscription for your Data Landing Zone.

options.text: Since not all service features are available in all regions, Enterprise-Scale Analytics is available in a subset of regions.

elements.name: locationName
elements.label: Location
elements.toolTip: Select the Location for your Data Landing Zone.

options.text: Specify a prefix and select an environment (Development, Test, Production) which will both be used as a prefix for all resource names. Independent of the environment, the same resources get deployed.

elements.name: environment
elements.label: Environment
elements.toolTip: Select the environment for the deployment.

allowedValues.label: Development
allowedValues.description: Select if you want to deploy a development environment.

allowedValues.label: Test
allowedValues.description: Select if you want to deploy a test environment.

allowedValues.label: Production
allowedValues.description: Select if you want to deploy a production environment.

elements.name: dataLandingZonePrefix
elements.label: Data Landing Zone Prefix
elements.toolTip: Specify a prefix (min 1 and max 10 lowercase characters and numbers).

validations.message: The prefix must be between 1-10 lowercase characters and numbers.
Prefix currently unavailable. Please choose a different one.

subLabel.preValidation: Provide settings for your Data Landing Zone deployment.

options.text: Select an administrator password for the Synapse workspaces and potentially Self-hosted integration runtimes hosted on VMSS.

toolTip.password: Specify an administrator password for the Synapse workspaces and Self-hosted integration runtimes hosted on VMSS.

constraints.customValidationMessage: The password must be alphanumeric, contain at least 8 characters, and have at least 1 letter, 1 number and one special character.

elements.name: deploySelfHostedIntegrationRuntimes
elements.label: Deploy Self-hosted Integration Runtimes
elements.toolTip: If selected, a Self-hosted Integration Runtime hosted on VMSS will be deployed.

constraints.validationMessage: Enable deployment of Self-hosted Integration Runtime hosted on VMSS.

options.text: Select the Purview account to which you want to connect Synapse and Data Factory.

elements.name: purviewId
elements.label: Connect to Purview Account
elements.toolTip: Select the Purview account to which you want to connect Synapse and Data Factory.

elements.name: purviewSelfHostedIntegrationRuntimeAuthKey

label.password: Purview Self-hosted Integration Runtime Authentication Key
label.confirmPassword: Confirm Purview Self-hosted Integration Runtime Authentication Key

elements.toolTip: Specify a Purview Self-hosted Integration Runtime Authentication Key to automatically create a Self-hosted Integration Runtime for Purview to scan private endpoint enabled datasources.

subLabel.preValidation: Provide all connectivity settings for your Data Landing Zone.

options.text: Specify the Virtual network and subnet CIDR range for your Data Landing Zone. Please make sure that the address space is not overlapping with the address space of your Data Management Zone and your other Data Landing Zones.

elements.name: virtualNetworkAddressCidrRange
elements.label: Vnet Address CIDR Range
elements.toolTip: Specify a Vnet address CIDR range within the range [10,24].

validations.message: Invalid CIDR range. The address prefix must be in the range [10,24].

elements.name: servicesSubnetAddressPrefix
elements.label: Core Landing Zone Services Subnet CIDR Range
elements.toolTip: Specify a CIDR range for the Core Data Landing Zone Services Subnet within the range [24,28].

validations.message: Invalid CIDR range. The address prefix must be in the range [24,28].
CIDR range not within virtual network CIDR range (first octet).
CIDR range not within virtual network CIDR range (second octet).
CIDR range not within virtual network CIDR range (third octet).
CIDR range not within virtual network CIDR range (subnet mask).

elements.name: dataManagementZoneVnetConfiguration
elements.label: Data Management Zone Virtual Network Configuration

options.text: Please select the Vnet of your Data Management Zone to peer it with your Data Landing Zone. Please peer the new Data Landing Zone Vnet to the Vnets of the existing Data Landing Zones manually after this deployment succeeded.

elements.name: dataManagementZoneSub
elements.label: Data Management Zone Subscription
elements.toolTip: Select the Subscription of your Data Management Zone.

elements.name: dataManagementZoneVirtualNetwork
elements.label: Data Management Zone Virtual Network
elements.toolTip: Select the Virtual Network of your Data Management Zone.

options.text: Specify the details of your shared network infrastructure in order to correctly setup the network configuration (Vnet and RouteTables).

elements.name: existingFirewallType
elements.label: Existing Firewall
elements.toolTip: Select the Firewall that is used inside your environment.

elements.name: azureFirewallSub
elements.label: Azure Firewall Subscription
elements.toolTip: Select the Subscription of your Azure Firewall.

elements.name: azureFirewallId
elements.label: Azure Firewall
elements.toolTip: Select the central Azure Firewall that should be used.

elements.name: firewallPrivateIp
elements.label: Firewall Private IP Address
elements.toolTip: Specify the private IP address of your Firewall.

validations.message: Invalid IP address. Please specify a single valid IP adress (e.g. '10.0.0.4').

elements.name: dnsServerAdresses
elements.label: DNS Server Addresses
elements.toolTip: Specify the private IP addresses of your DNS forwarders. You can specify more than one private IP address ('10.0.0.4,10.0.0.5').

validations.message: Invalid IP addresses. Please specify one or more valid IP adresses (e.g. '10.0.0.4' or '10.0.0.4,10.0.0.5').

options.text: Select the Private DNS Zone settings for your deployment.

We are deploying all services with private endpoints and disabled public network access to reduce the data exfiltration risk. For each private endpoint, DNS A-records need to be created in a Private DNS Zones. Therefore, these either need to deployed through Azure Policies or you have to provide the Private DNS Zones that should be used for this deployment. We are assuming that all Private DNS Zones are created in the same subscription. Deploying DNS A-Records through Private Endpoints is the recommended solution.

elements.name: automatedPrivateDnsZoneGroups
elements.label: DNS A-Records are deployed through Azure Policy
elements.toolTip: If 'No' is selected, you will have to choose private DNS Zones that will be used for the A-Record deployment of the private DNS Zones.

elements.name: privateDnsZonesSub
elements.label: Private DNS Zone Subscription
elements.toolTip: Select the Subscription of your Private DNS Zones.

elements.name: privateDnsZoneIdKeyVault
elements.label: Private DNS Zone Key Vault (privatelink.vaultcore.azure.net)
elements.toolTip: Private DNS Zone for Key Vault (privatelink.vaultcore.azure.net).

constraints.allowedValues: [map(filter(steps('connectivitySettings').privateDnsZones.privateDnsZonesApi.value,(item) => contains(item.name, 'privatelink.vaultcore.azure.net')),(item) => parse(concat('{"label":"', item.name, '","value":"', item.id, '","description":"', 'Resource Group: ', last(take(split(item.id, '/'), 5)), '"}')))]

elements.name: privateDnsZoneIdDataFactory
elements.label: Private DNS Zone DataFactory (privatelink.datafactory.azure.net)
elements.toolTip: Private DNS Zone for DataFactory (privatelink.datafactory.azure.net).
